channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-14346] Change the default value for hive.mapred.mode to null
item.description:
HIVE-12727 introduces three new configurations to replace the existing hive.mapred.mode, which is deprecated. However, the default value for the latter is 'nonstrict', which prevent the new configurations from being used (see comments in that JIRA for more details).

This proposes to change the default value for hive.mapred.mode to null. Users can then set the three new configurations to get more fine-grained control over the strict checking. If user want to use the old configuration, they can set hive.mapred.mode to strict/nonstrict.
item.summary: Change the default value for hive.mapred.mode to null

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: cc sershe, xuefuz, leftylev.
+1; might break Q files. Is it accessed anywhere else without the default where it might break?
It might. There're a few places which set this to nonstrict, mostly are in tests, but one in SemanticAnalyzer. I don't think this will break those.

Doc note: The wiki will need to be updated with the new default value for hive.mapred.mode in release 2.2.0. (It also needs to be updated with HIVE-12727's changes to the default and description.)

  • Configuration Properties – hive.mapred.mode

Added a TODOC2.2 label.
I just added affect version 2.1.1 because i encounter this issue when hive version 2.1.1.
